sentences.english: The other likelihood is that you delegated prematurely.
sentences.chinese: 另一种可能性是，你进行了仓促的授权。

sentences.english: 'You don't want to quit precipitously since you can traumatize yourself even more by facing extended un employment .
sentences.chinese: 他说，不要仓促离职，因为长期失业会让你更加苦恼。

sentences.english: Many young cows were trampled to death in the rush.
sentences.chinese: 在仓促跳跑时，许多小牛被踩死。

sentences.english: After a really short explanation, the staff member who came up began to leave.
sentences.chinese: 终于上来的员工居然在超快超仓促的解释后就要走。

sentences.english: That too-hasty profit snatched from approaching loss.
sentences.chinese: 一件眼前损失的仓促的利益。

sentences.english: The directors railroaded their chairman into a decision.
sentences.chinese: 董事们迫使董事长仓促作出决定。

sentences.english: Because the book was written in haste, it contains many mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 这本书因为仓促许写成有许多错误。

sentences.english: I excused myself hastily and left her to the ministrations of the other soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 我仓促地辨解了自己并且留下了她给其他战士的帮助。

sentences.english: His wife told him not to go off at halfcock.
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子告诉他不要仓促行事。

sentences.english: I tasted the paste in haste and cast it on the waste plaster.
sentences.chinese: 我匆仓促品味了浆糊然后将其丢在废泥灰上。

sentences.english: There are various problems in Selections, but it was not compiled in haste.
sentences.chinese: 《文选》存在着种种问题，然非仓促成书。

sentences.english: Of course, foreign vintners probably rushed into things a bit precipitously.
sentences.chinese: 当然，国外酒商可能有点仓促行事了。

sentences.english: I was rush into buying these expensive boots.
sentences.chinese: 我是在匆忙中仓促决定买下这双价格昂贵的靴子的。

sentences.english: the heading is "headline of headlong pleadings".
sentences.chinese: 标题为“仓促答辩状的择要”。

sentences.english: The finely detailed, the hasty, length short legs feeling.
sentences.chinese: 前文细致详尽，后文有些仓促，身长腿短的感觉。

sentences.english: Jack flees out a back window, narrowly escaping the agents.
sentences.chinese: 杰克从后窗仓促逃走，勉强地逃过了特工们的追捕。

definition: there's not enough time (to do sth)/it's too late (to do sth)
to act against one's will/to have no alternative but to/to have to/to have no choice/must
there's still time/able to do sth in time
to be caught off guard/without warning
to have no alternative (idiom); compelled by circumstances/forced into sth
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
no time to deal with it (idiom); caught unprepared
just before the battle/to approach the front line
